reviews.text: Very very nice preview of the city. You can see old castle on the top of Graz. Lot of green areas and places to sit and feel fresh air. Christmas market in period of Christmas holidays is something special here, you can feel smell of boiled wine and cinnamon everywhere. All recommendations for this place.

There are four ways to climb on the hill. By foot (260 stairs), by funicular (I think it is still under construction), by elevator or by car. I visited the hill twice, once by foot and second by car. On the hill you are witness to a beautiful sight to the whole city. There is one big clock tower, two restaurants, one big stage for cultural events and one of the most beautiful bars with amazing view over the city. Be aware that this bar is closed almost whole February, so avoid to visit it then :) Try local beer there! It is a perfect spot for romantic moments, so guys you should take your girls there :)
Very nice view of the entire city. A bit challenging but possible on foot. For those who would like more comfort there is an opportunity to use a funicular or an elevator.

Great view of the city. Worth visiting. However, do not go by car, the parking fee is horribly high. Everything is only in german. If you do not speak the language, you can't make out much. I will not go again.
Very nice view of the entire city of Graz! You have to go up there. Very beautiful historical monuments too. You have to go down by the slide.
Perfect. Historical.

Balıkesir Saat Kulesi - Balıkesir

Saat Kulesi 1829 yılında Girit’li Mehmet Paşa tarafından İstanbul Galata Kulesi’nin benzeri olarak silindir şeklinde yaptırılmış idi. 1897 yılındaki deprem nedeniyle yıkılınca, 1901 yılında bugünkü şekliyle yeniden yaptırılmıştır. Kare prizma şeklindeki bina, beyaz kesme taş ile yapılmış ve kabartma işçiliklerle de süslü hale getirilmiştir.En üst kat kubbe ile örtülmüş ve büyük bir çan eklenmiştir. Buranın hemen altındaki katta ise dört yöne de birer saat konmuştur.

Bu kadar değerli bir eserin bu kadar biçimsiz bir noktada kalması kötü olmuş. Kuleyi yapanlar ileriyi görememişler. Kilise çanı benzeri her saat başı çalması müslüman mahallesinde salyangoza benziyor bu ses değişmeli
Şehire ayrı bir hava katan mimari yapı. Ne zaman çan başlasa içimden pink floyd high hopes mırıldanmama sebep oluyor..o nedenle ayrı seviyorum.
Kültürel mirasımızın emanet ettiği güzel yapılardan birisi
The interior is nice,the music was great.I liked the coffee.You can smoke there.It's in the centre.
Wonderful Austrian cuisine and beer
Nice and quiet seating area outside with huge fashionable furniture. Reasonable prices for breakfast which they serve until afternoon. Yummy omelette!
Nice Location to go for a date
Homebase

Didn't visit the museum but the bar next to it. Can recommend: Very tasty spritzers and tasty beers. Atmosphere is great and staff was friendly. Only had to wait a bit long before they come take your order.
The Kunsthaus Graz, Grazer Kunsthaus is a museum of contemporary art built in 2003. I did not visit it, but the shape of this building immediately caught my eye because of its originality.
Architecturally, the Kunsthaus is a thing of beauty - a work of art. Inside is equally impressive. The exhibitions are nicely curated. 'Camera Austria' is currently displayed.
The breakfast was very good. The place deserves visiting.
good food , located near centre

If I could use only one word to describe this place it would be - awesome! There are thousands of various pieces of armor, weaponry and other military artifacts to admire, a dream come true for any history buff. We even got to see the famous horse armor (the guide kindly asked us to keep our pictures for private use, so I'll respect their request, but there are plenty of pictures of it online). Armory is accessible only via guided tour, but it's well worth the admission fee (12 EUR for adults).

Absolutely unique collection of war equipment from the middle ages! There is nothing comparable worldwide! A must-see for every tourist visiting Austria. Easy to reach in the city centre of Graz. Guides available, Audio-Guides, too. Museum shop available. Wheel-chair and push-chair accessible.
Amazing place. Come in summer or spring though. Learned a new German expression - "I smell the match"
Great Museum of war history.

This is the armoury in Graz, and holds a wonderful selection of 15th to 18th century weapons and armour. What is initially suprising is that it is truely an armoury- you might have a rack of 50 pistols, and then a wall of halberds, instead of the one of this, one of that, you might see in a museum. However, this certainly does not detract from the experience. The collection includes everything from huge two handed swords (Zweihänder), to incredibly ornate pistols (well worth checking out), to cannons, to a full suit of horse armour, to firearms that looked like rifles but were so large they were operated by a team of people and needed a stand. The whole armoury has relativley subdued lighting to preserve the collection. 
There are short guides in a range of languages and audio guides (sadly I did not have chance to make use of this as I only had an hour before closing- but certainly better than not seeing it at all!). I would have appreciated more notes/signs as a large amount of the collection is just there without information.
If you are in Graz and want to see something a little different this is well worth it.
Other practical things: there are toilets and a lift, plus quite a large shop
The location is everything - a standard beer garden with an unbeatable view.
Friendly staff and a great view of the city.
Was not open during our visit end of March but can see great potential when open in the summer....
Was Amazing come by to this place🥂🥂

OK, good schnitzel, not so good burger. Beer a tad expensive for self service. Closes at the merest hint of bad weather. A live band plays every now and then geared towards the simple and geriatric. The manageress will then reserve the best table for her friends. 
The third star is for the staff who are friendly and helpful.
Everything I tasted was excellent. You must try the pumpkin. Very cosy and graphical place

First of all the food is very, very tasty. The staff is kind but maybe too fast in bringing the food and drinks. We had the impression that they wanted to get rid of us as soon as possible and make a space for new guests.
Good food. Cozy place. Great place to have lunch and a nice conversation. The staff is very friendly.
Amazing food and ambience. One of the most properly prepared beef I ever tasted.
Service-quality is top-notch, like it used to be in almost all of Austria. Great Athmosphere and fantastic traditional austrian kitchen, totally recommend!

As an original Spanish, I don't consider that this place serves Spanish food. Moreover they give small expensive portions. I'm being honest giving 2 starts for advertising wrong image, and consider to spend better my money on other restaurants near by
Great offer of red wine. Nice atmosphere and music
The atmosphere in the front part (the bar and the high tables) is what makes this place attractive. The food is ok but the portions are comparably small and a bit on the expensive side
Excellent
Very good food. The different sauces were interesting to try. Salad dressing was too salty. Service was great!
